meanings.definition: To attach a new label to something.
meanings.sent1: I will relabel the boxes with the correct names.
meanings.sent2: She decided to relabel the jars in the pantry for better organization.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf tried to relabel the cookies as vegetables, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: After the breakup, she felt like she needed to relabel her emotions to move on.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to relabel the map with the correct countries.

meanings.definition: To change the label on something.
meanings.sent1: Please relabel the file with the new date.
meanings.sent2: He had to relabel the folders to match the new system.
meanings.sent3: The prankster decided to relabel the office supplies with funny names.
meanings.sent4: As the seasons change, nature seems to relabel itself with different colors.
meanings.sent5: The museum curator had to relabel the artifacts after new information was discovered.

meanings.definition: The act of putting a new label on something.
meanings.sent1: The relabel of the products was necessary for the marketing campaign.
meanings.sent2: She completed the relabel of the items on the shelves before the store opened.
meanings.sent3: The relabel of the books in the library led to a more organized system.
meanings.sent4: In life, we often go through a relabel of our priorities as we grow.
meanings.sent5: The relabel of the exhibits at the museum brought in more visitors.
